title: Question 9
prompt: Based on the above information which of the following would indicate an apparent causal relationship?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) has affected Mexican agriculture in the following ways:
  • A decline in maize production and increase in fruit and vegetable production on large farms with connections to U.S. agricultural business interests.
  • An increase in fruit and vegetable export to the U.S. from large Mexican farms, including a doubling of tomato export.
  • A three-fold increase in maize imports from the U.S. to Mexico.
  • A drop of 50% in maize prices, resulting in lower prices for Mexican consumers and livestock owners, but lower income for 3 million small farmers with non-irrigated hillside fields.
feedback: This question requires an understanding of the idea of supply and demand. According to the economic law of supply and demand, a larger supply of a product (assuming the demand remains the same) will generate a reduction in price of that product. Since maize imports to Mexico tripled after NAFTA, there was a larger supply of maize in the Mexican marketplace. Based on supply and demand, a drop in price could be expected, and the price did drop by 50%. This is presumably a causal relationship.
